meanings.definition: A small, straight knife with a very sharp blade, used in surgery.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon carefully held the scalpel during the operation.
meanings.sent2: The doctor reached for the scalpel to make a precise incision.
meanings.sent3: The scalpel decided it wanted to be a chef knife instead.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as a scalpel, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gleam of the scalpel under the bright lights of the operating room was intimidating.
